full_threads.body:
Thanks Heath, I'd emailed about a minute before you with the good news. I think we have also solved our other issue!

Casey
Rebels SUPPORT

e. rebels@tarabliss.com.au
w. tarabliss.com.au/rebels-of-light

Hello again!

Just as you processed your test order our failed order made it through - not sure what was up but she's in now.

She also managed to process a QTY of 4 subscriptions at once. I've fixed it up and refunded her for the additionial payments but is there any way we can make it so the cart either doesn't save previous 'add to cart' actions OR there's a note to prompt them to check their order before processing?

Many thanks!!

Casey
Rebels SUPPORT

e. rebels@tarabliss.com.au
w. tarabliss.com.au/rebels-of-light

Hi Casey, 

I have just completed a test as you will see, and it's working. Did you manage to find the 'enable guest checkouts option' in the WooCommerce settings by any change. This normally the fix for that error mesage and it's already enabled. Let me know?

Morning Heath!

I was hoping to email this morning to say that we'd been able to confirm the issue has resolved but unfortunately not.

Have you seen this before with WooCommerce Subscriptions? Hoping it's easy to solve.

Cheers,

Casey
Rebels SUPPORT

e. rebels@tarabliss.com.au
w. tarabliss.com.au/rebels-of-light

Hi Heath,

We've set Rebels live into the world, yay! But we've had a teething issue, that I suspect a couple of folks might have encountered.

We had someone trying to sign up on a subscription tonight who rec. the attached message.

I ended up testing with my own CC with full price to see if I could replicate the issue and I could not, and I can't see in the settings where it might be.

I asked about which browser she's using in case there's some bizarre thing going on there, though I don't think it would be that.

Please help! Thank you.

Casey
Rebels SUPPORT

e. rebels@tarabliss.com.au
w. tarabliss.com.au/rebels-of-light

action.text: Rica Rosario Valencia assigned to Heath Maguire

full_threads.body:
Hiya again :)

Got a couple more to add to that list, thanks!

4. The anchor menu up top is showing as an orange background when we scroll, it should remain with a black background and the text changes to orange on hover.
5. When Emma logs into the account dashboard she's got a option that says 'register as affiliate' but I don't have it. How do we make sure that never shows for anyone as this is invite only (pics attached). I can't see it in the affiliate settings.

Casey
Rebels SUPPORT

e. rebels@tarabliss.com.au
w. tarabliss.com.au/rebels-of-light

Hi Emma, 

I have been working on the below and have it sorted for you. In response to your questions:

When I view the dummy product, I can't buy it :) which means I can't test it - can you please fix the CSS or modules to enable me to purchase and give it a go?
***Yeah, the website is not coded to use WooCommerce in a normal way. A little bit confusing. I have now created a product called '2021 Product'. This will enable you to checkout etc. I have cloned it from an existing program, so hopefully you will be able simply update/replace copy as needed. Here is the link to the product in the backend: https://tarabliss.com.au/wp-admin/post.php?post=14853&action=edit

WooCommerce is actually far, far, far more complex than ThriveCart, can you please direct Casey and myself to some training videos or can you run us through how we can use it?
***Sure, here is an overview: https://www.loom.com/share/39dbb6fcb83549fbb795d37622c03f84

I have questions around us changing payment so right now the plan is: - May 10 - earlybird cart opens (Cost is $2997) only one option to pay and that's a big old lump sum. - May 17 earlybird cart CLOSES -May 24 the standard cart re-opens and we have 2 payment options cost is $3497 AUD and the two payment options are 1 x payment for the full amount OR 3 x payments of $1167 I need to confirm this with casey, we might be charging them a premium for doing the payment plan) So, with this being explained now, a few questions 
***I have set this up on the above product to show you. The earlybird offer AND the normal 3x payments are both live... purely to show you this. There is toggle to turn on or off the different payment options (e.g. earlybird versus normal rate). 

How can we set that up I guess with cart opening then closing, and then needing a different amount and offering payment plan? Can It be done on the "one product" or do we have to create a second "product" when the standard cart opens?
***Needs to be multiple products, more details here: https://www.loom.com/share/39dbb6fcb83549fbb795d37622c03f84 (same video as above)

Your answer to question 1 is likely to answer this, but I need to consider what "triggers" I need to set off the automation in active campaign which sends them emails with instructions on whats next and how to log in.
***Correct it will likely be a purchase of product xyz. Noting that the products in this case are, earlybird one-time fee, normal one-time fee, normal 3x payment fee. So you would have 3 separate triggers. 

The automation also triggers their access to our membership site. So if the product name or product ID changes based on the cart question above - that's fine - I just need to be aware so I can add that into the automation. 
***Yes, each product will have a different ID number. Here's how to find them: https://www.loom.com/share/5bef4d5bd7e9461daff5cfbc2217b94a

Finally, I'd love to understand how folks will get their receipts and be able to jump in and update their credit card details should their payments fail and what that looks like?
***The WooCommerce My Account page handles this: https://tarabliss.com.au/my-account/ This should probably be added to the user menu though... It's not currently there. 

Hope this helps and shout out if you need any more info?

Hi Heath, I've jumped in today and set up the integration between WooCommerce & Active Campaign. From Active Campaign we can control Active360 membership and mostly everything we need. I've attached a screenshot to show you how we'll trigger our automations - basically we can use many ecommerce fields but the product name or Product ID enables us to be super specific. I have also attached a screenshot of that for your reference. So where to from here:
  • When I view the dummy product, I can't buy it :) which means I can't test it - can you please fix the CSS or modules to enable me to purchase and give it a go?
  • WooCommerce is actually far, far, far more complex than ThriveCart, can you please direct Casey and myself to some training videos or can you run us through how we can use it?
  • I have questions around us changing payment so right now the plan is: - May 10 - earlybird cart opens (Cost is $2997) only one option to pay and that's a big old lump sum. - May 17 earlybird cart CLOSES -May 24 the standard cart re-opens and we have 2 payment options cost is $3497 AUD and the two payment options are 1 x payment for the full amount OR 3 x payments of $1167 I need to confirm this with casey, we might be charging them a premium for doing the payment plan) So, with this being explained now, a few questions 1. How can we set that up I guess with cart opening then closing, and then needing a different amount and offering payment plan? Can It be done on the "one product" or do we have to create a second "product" when the standard cart opens? 2. Your answer to question 1 is likely to answer this, but I need to consider what "triggers" I need to set of the automation in active campaign which sends them emails with instructions on whats next and how to log in. The automation also triggers their access to our membership site. So if the product name or product ID changes based on the cart question above - that's fine - I just need to be aware so I can add that into the automation. Finally, I'd love to understand how folks will get their receipts and be able to jump in and update their credit card details should their payments fail and what that looks like?
Thanks Heath, and I appreciate jumping on a call may be easier so let me know. Also, cart really is meant to open on Saturday if we can't achieve this by Tuesday COB we may need to consider switching back to ThriveCart... which would not be ideal. Cheers Emma

Good morning Heath,

Yes, on the subscription side of things or even all purchases, does the receipt come from woo commerce? If so that's fine, we just need informational emails to come from Active Campaign and that just involves tags being added on checkout - this is actually essential to what we do.

I will have a play tomorrow. Just for piece of mind, when was the last backup of the website taken and should I break it, who do I contact to restore it?

Cheers,
Emma

Hi Emma, 

Yes I'm well, hope you are too. 

I have created a dummy product here: https://tarabliss.com.au/wp-admin/post.php?post=14845&action=edit

So far as integration with Active Campaign/Member360, we are not sure as we don't support Active Campaign. I'm also really hesitant to poke around as I don't want to throw anything out. 

We are on standby to build out a subscription product page for Casey though. So assumably this would need to be integrated with AC as well? Let me know how you go, I'll try to help out as much as possible, particularly from the WordPress side of things.

action.text: Rica Rosario Valencia assigned to Heath Maguire

full_threads.body:
Hi Heath,

I hope you're well.

Is it possible you can setup a dummy product page in woo commerce and integrate activemember360 and active campaign?

On Sunday I'll be jumping in to setup some tests to check our flow post purchase (email automations and access to the member's section).

The copy will likely come through early next week so we're trying to have the backbones in place to ensure we can quickly deploy.

It doesn't have to be a fancy product page, I just need to start understanding and testing woocommerce and how it plugs into our other systems.

Thanks
Emma
